synthesis_conditions.notes: A novel NIT radical derivative with an aromatic group for chain robustness and an aliphatic tail for flexibility.

synthesis_conditions.asymmetric_unit: Two and a half radicals and two and a half terbium atoms
synthesis_conditions.notes: The stoichiometric reaction of NIT-O-hexyl with the [Tb(hfac)3·2 H2O] building block affords the product. The crystal packing forms a chiral tubular superstructure with an external diameter of 6.8 nm and an inner bore of 4.5 nm filled by disordered heptane molecules.

general_notes: The synthesis involves the reaction of a novel NIT radical derivative with a terbium(III) building block, leading to the formation of chiral supramolecular nanotubes. The reaction solvent heptane plays a key role in the thermodynamic stabilization of these nanotubes. The compound is stable up to a melting temperature of 120 88C. Upon removal from the mother solution, the crystals quickly lose their crystallinity but not their crystal shape, as observed in SEM images.
